title: Problem with email in outbox
creator: catweazle883311
content:
Can someone advise please, I am using an android tablet and have had no problems with thunderbird until recently. I send and receive email from multiple accounts, but occasionally it will stick the email in the outbox and nothing I do will send it.

The email address is correct because if I go to yahoo it will send the message.

It appears to be totally random from any of the six accounts I use. I have deleted each account, reinstalled thunderbird. No difference. I can send mail it goes yo outbox, send another and it gets sent. ??

I am getting to the stage where I am going to abandon thunderbird because I think email is sent and its not.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; Android 10; K) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/141.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

title: Thunderbird mobile doesn't send email in outbox
creator: gerrit.leder
content:
Hello all,

Thank you for Thunderbird mobile!

I get a message not sent error when doing the following on Android smartphone: - click an email address link - create email opens - send completed email

Expected result: Email goes to outbox and is removed after sending

Actual result: - email stays in outbox and error cannot send is displayed - when moving email to Entw√ºrfe and send again the sending succeeds, but email is present twice in sent folder

Please have a look!

Best regards Gerrit

title: Gmail Folders Shown Sometimes as Hierarchical, Sometimes Not
creator: whitedavidp
content:
Both screen shots below are from the same phone, same TB version, same account, etc. They were taken only a few minutes apart during the same, ongoing, TB session. This is TB 13 off Play Store (not beta).

Quite frankly, I dislike the hierarchical (which I see ONLY on my 2 gmail accounts - not in either Outlook or Yahoo - thankfully) and would much prefer the non-hierarchical all the time as it is consistent across accounts and takes less effort to get at folders like Sent and Trash - which are hidden/buried in hierarchical views.

What I don't understand is why/how the same gmail account shows folders in both hierarchical and non-hierarchical. It was my impression that hierarchical was introduced as an "improvement" at some point between K9 and now. Is this a bug? Am I doing something to make this happen? If so, how can I do it again to make it non-hierarchical all the time :-)

Thanks!
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:135.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/135.0;solver_id:2845339
